com.carnival.sdk

Interface NotificationSilencer

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    NotificationSilencer

    public NotificationSilencer

    Implement NotificationSilencer if you want to suppress any received notification to be presented by Carnival

    Note: Direct to URI notifications using the _u parameter will never call com.carnival.sdk.NotificationSilencer$isSilent(android.content.Context,android.os.Bundle)

    You could use this to silence notifications from other providers or Receive a notification to start a special background service

    Example of usage to silent notifications when the custom key `silent` is present.

    Create your implementation: 

      
       class MyNotificationSilencer implements NotificationSilencer {
           @Override
           boolean isSilent(Context context, Bundle bundle) {
               return bundle.containsKey("silent")
           }
       }
    Add your implementation using com.carnival.sdk.NotificationConfig$setSilencer(com.carnival.sdk.NotificationSilencer) 
      
       ...
       Carnival.startEngine(getApplicationContext(), "your sdk key");
       NotificationConfig notificationConfig = new NotificationConfig();
       notificationConfig.setSilencer(new MyNotificationSilencer());
       Carnival.setNotificationConfig(notificationConfig);
       ...

    See Also:
    com.carnival.sdk.NotificationSilencer$isSilent(android.content.Context,android.os.Bundle), com.carnival.sdk.NotificationConfig$setSilencer(com.carnival.sdk.NotificationSilencer)

    • Method Detail

      • isSilent

        boolean isSilent(android.content.Context context,
                 android.os.Bundle bundle)

        Return true to silence a Notification. Silent notifications will not be presented to the user.

        Parameters:
        context - The application context
        bundle - Notification extras
        Returns:
        org.jetbrains.dokka.NodeRenderContent@260b0232: true if this notification should not be presented
